document.title: Georgiaâ€™s K-12 Standards for English Language Arts (SY2025-2026)

6940EA2A2F8646C2878F5033ED8DDBA5.description: Determine what makes a source text credible and relevant and identify examples. (I)

162DA042BDFA4E68B8F6EF0982075599.description: Refer to specific passages from a text to support an idea, answer, or opinion. (I)

B2ED4EC4DDAC4C9CB4BF68C0DCCD8DB7.description: Curating Sources & Evidence Integrate evidence from print and digital sources, assessing credibility and relevance and avoiding plagiarism.

6D7789E8AEB941CCBA6B4EA343B33489.description: Summarize researched, relevant, and accurate information from at least two credible sources about a self-selected topic. (C)

698C4E53B8DB4B4B892C840C65F6325A.description: Conduct research by locating, gathering, selecting, and organizing information from multiple credible sources, including print, digital, and personal communication, about a self-selected topic. (I)

14C05801B800429F8106AA3DEEE65D68.description: Generate questions about a self-selected topic of interest to be researched, formulating additional questions to clarify or deepen understanding. (I)

E74EE09B985C4B4D96166B121BC827E5.description: Research & Inquiry Conduct research to ask and answer questions that clarify, deepen, and extend understanding of a topic of interest using credible sources and communicating relevant and accurate information.

EBD98E22C9154EA6AA2DC106C142E087.description: Research & Analysis Students use, discuss, analyze, and curate texts as they engage in various conversations, activities, and projects about a range of grade-level texts and topics.

B6E35765AC6E4CF8A1D302205E6522FF.description: Apply poetic techniques to produce poetry and engage audiences that use rhyme in at least two stanzas to achieve an intended effect. (C)

F05D422C033A45B9BB1A634C4798D527.description: Discuss and explain techniques used to present and design poetry, including rhyme scheme. (I)

5D97BC694E65475684CC40845F86E4C1.description: Poetic Techniques Explain, analyze, and use poetic techniques to shape understandings.

44E61609E4D94FD4A75E25DDD5D96D6A.description: Apply opinion techniques to create opinion pieces that introduce the topic, state an opinion about the topic, supply reasons to support the opinion with linking words (e.g., because, therefore, since, for example) to connect the opinion and reasons, and provide a concluding statement or section. (C)

7AE825D5D2594826A82BA4DD61F0759B.description: Describe and discuss the techniques used to present and design opinion texts, including authorâ€™s opinion statement, supporting reasons, and evidence. (I)

352BEF6A65964527989D732851475421.description: Opinion Techniques Explain, analyze, and use opinion techniques to shape understandings.

84CE076BB13C4514B7F8FABA8F5ECC88.description: Apply expository techniques to introduce a topic, develop the topic with facts and other information (e.g., definitions, details, illustrations), and provide a concluding statement or section. (C)

0C77C9FA24A24355922244F2497EA3BB.description: Integrate and explain information from two texts on the same topic in relationship to important points and key details. (I)

77A2DA1BC0D4489C9BAC660F5AD81C5E.description: Describe the relationship between a series of historical events, scientific ideas or concepts, or steps in technical procedures in a text. (I)

E6C4C07496D1426998AA185AEE4B1A64.description: Describe the techniques used to present and design expository texts, including facts and key details used to support the main idea. (I)

36BCDB49AC534CBEBA71E06DAD74813A.description: Expository Techniques Explain, analyze, and use expository techniques to shape understandings.

680D4365025C4B05A3E643A61A50A270.description: Apply narrative techniques (e.g., character, setting, problem, resolution, dialogue) to develop a real or imagined experience using descriptive details, clear event sequences, and a sense of closure. (C)

C4CA469559714B41B262919C9C4B2E2E.description: Compare and contrast two or more characters, settings, central messages, or events within texts across diverse cultures. (I)

1E6781A1CF3F46729C1AA6108C66CC76.description: Describe charactersâ€™ traits, motivations, actions, thoughts, and feelings and explain their connection to the central message, lesson, or moral of the story. (I)

2EAB2447967446F1A564030864A873AB.description: Explain how characters, setting, problem, and solution function in the plot. (I)

F61E58B68B444A31B46060E8960B86E1.description: Explain how narrative techniques are used to present ideas, design texts, and convey information about characters, setting, and plot. (I)

FC9665B0E3BF41909A533DB5E598BDEB.description: Narrative Techniques Explain, analyze, and use narrative techniques to shape understandings.

9317E7C8A4E64CC485E804B07DFB9BC1.description: Techniques Students explain, analyze, and use various techniques to comprehend and shape meaning.

9016E2F8CEB847EBA9C2EE86F4ECA2B0.description: Use figurative language, such as similes, metaphors, and idioms, to show relationships between ideas and information. (C)

11ADB9F58213416DAB5419449F644A12.description: Identify and describe the use of figurative language, such as similes, metaphors, and idioms in a wide variety of texts. (I)

F1372641C7E74094B1BD778F64748A6A.description: Craft Use language to interpret meaning and craft engaging texts.

1AE4968745D34E72A6CF8958F2A1EAEE.description: Craft related sentences into clear and cohesive paragraphs. (C)

97E696A8FDE749E0BB3703DFC4A93D1E.description: Use conjunctions and transition words or phrases, such as although and since, to add cohesion and link ideas and information. (C)

1A0989720597416A9CA583164775AD11.description: Design texts using a variety of text structures and features, according to purpose and audience. (C)

70E54F14525446AFBEDD4CE1193FE472.description: Describe how texts are arranged to represent information and ideas using text features (e.g., map, captions) and organizational structures (e.g., cause/effect), referring to parts of texts using terms such as chapter or section. (I)

F5D7A54C09464DB6BAEC5E36D2231085.description: Organization Demonstrate and apply understanding of organizational structures and elements to create coherent and engaging texts.

FE7D25D940F246CDB2C0F0FCCE5A70C3.description: Structure & Style Students build and apply knowledge about language and organizational structures and elements used to convey and arrange ideas and information in texts.

75E006BD254C49D99EFD7002456FB169.description: With adult support, identify the context in which a text is written (e.g., time period, individual, situational). (I)

9D79AE59F2E14E1EB7ACBBE42AA199C2.description: Describe different perspectives of the narrator or speakers and distinguish them from their own. (I)

2664C989C9884AA1A7E09ABF1445861B.description: Authors & Speakers Make connections between authors of texts, speakers in texts, varying perspectives, and the circumstances in which texts are produced.

900599EDFC044C9695CFD7F72190D80D.description: Create multimodal texts, using features of pre-selected modes for a specific purpose and audience. (C)

A308AFBCB83B47FF86994525D10F494E.description: Recognize different texts by mode and describe how the different modes of communication: print, digital, auditory, spoken, visual, and multimodal, contribute to the overall purpose and effect. (I)

7237D4F9624B4666AC9603FA1F450E2C.description: Determine the purpose (e.g., entertain, inform, persuade) and target audience of a text. (I)

E12FF1C87E2C43E3AAA6926B71013804.description: Purpose & Audience Use knowledge of purposes and audiences, as well as the language that develops those relationships, to make meaning of texts in multiple modes.

CC226E7B5D23496EA930829D43EA39F9.description: Context Students describe the influences of purpose and audience on texts.

FC1974902F9B409EBBF674B7EACC6BF8.description: Texts (T) Students grow in their learning as they purposefully engage with texts.

F52CD5778C4C4EF89F0F301C745ADD8C.description: Use knowledge of word relationships and learned vocabulary words and phrases to make precise word choices when speaking and writing. (C)

0D45506FF3474E6296AA0D5BC934156D.description: Use glossaries or beginning dictionaries, both print and digital, to check spelling and to determine or clarify the precise meaning of words and phrases. (I)

6BF7C000363F4A3A8C7ED0087C78C4AE.description: Distinguish shades of meaning among closely related verbs (e.g., toss, throw, hurl) and closely related adjectives (e.g., thin, slender, skinny, scrawny). (I)

B72208D156FC4A0EA6AFF7D25EE2D937.description: Identify homophones and homographs and use the relationship between synonyms and antonyms to clarify word meanings. (I)

1BEAA30198044279A9932468BA5FFB6B.description: Use context (e.g., images and graphs) within and beyond a sentence to determine or clarify the meaning of unknown words and multiple-meaning words and phrases. (I)

4419143BE131497082D9152AD4A0B023.description: Meaning & Purpose Make connections between words and phrases and use reference materials to determine or clarify word meanings in a variety of settings and for a variety of purposes.

D0656015765243A698BDE736042FC55B.description: Construct words using common roots, root words, and affixes. (C)

7B8A5571CEE54ED8B7847768BE564657.description: Identify affixes associated with specific parts of speech (e.g., ly is commonly used with adverbs) to aid comprehension. (I)

D7B2D57877CC461CB5A777BCFA78EF88.description: Deconstruct words using common roots, root words, and affixes to determine meaning. (I)

6DCF1FA61FF244E69F4E323F6064110F.description: Word Analysis Acquire and apply word analysis skills to determine the meanings of words and to communicate with precision in a variety of settings.

6D10A12FA9A24A60B875FAE773C0C2F9.description: Use grade-level general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases to enhance communication in a variety of settings. (C)

6B6653255158403D9DF5E2A63FA99300.description: Acquire a range of general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases through grade-level texts and content. (I)

C9408DBDE5F743529202AFE099319D48.description: General, Academic, & Specialized Vocabulary Acquire and use general, academic, and specialized vocabulary words and phrases with precision in a variety of settings.

7B7C3B369DAF4C799F074D1ABD9B0D53.description: Vocabulary Students engage in a wide range of written and spoken activities during which they expand and deepen their vocabularies, build word analysis skillsets (morphology), and determine or clarify the meanings of words and phrases.

739CEEDC7F2540E1A114FAF16A2D070D.description: Elaborate on ideas and information, using adjectives and adverbs when incorporating details and descriptions to convey precise meaning. (C)

2439AC242A6B49A7946B8EA1A0971B3C.description: Use correct subject-verb agreement in a variety of sentences. (C)

7B615B5EBFCB4F9CAE5A3B6A69800329.description: Use a variety of simple, compound, and complex sentences to strengthen clarity and coherence, establishing consistent verb tense within and between sentences. (C)

7D88CB4BE15248269BF9C6C66911167B.description: Distinguish between correctly structured simple, compound, and complex sentences. (I)

08FE3801667E45F8B2F347DF9A71C0D5.description: Syntax Apply understandings of sentence structure to comprehend and compose varied sentences.

7AC51AF93FE34B3196DDB4A4BC45B029.description: Mechanics: Use conventional capitalization and underlining, quotation marks, or italics to indicate titles of works. (Introduce)

247FD954F9DD4EB4A492E9F9FE0BD0FA.description: Mechanics: Use commas after introductory phrases or clauses. (Introduce)

EB528C707B0542F7A12F4D69D753962D.description: Grammar: Use subordinating conjunctions to join clauses. (Introduce)

018F27D18E854E49A4F290B7ED1DACF2.description: "Grammar: Use indefinite pronouns, ensuring correct agreement. (Introduce)

BBD2B8813C9F42EBB253028932DAB575.description: Mechanics: Use apostrophes to form plural possessive nouns. (Introduce)

4C8064243D8C423AB9A6EBAEC8B36369.description: Mechanics: Use commas to indicate direct address and to set off the words yes and no. (Introduce)

8622D38182074BD68BBA4B80771BEC9B.description: Mechanics: Recognize and use conventional capitalization in abbreviations, proper adjectives, and formal titles. (Introduce)

29132956222341069C556FBF896FBB36.description: "Usage: Correctly use frequently confused words (e.g., to/too/two; there/their/theyâ€™re; advice/advise). (Introduce)

AC6071310F63488083ADC9DF30D0D9F9.description: Grammar: Use helping and linking verbs. (Introduce)

D8D125D6C6AA4279AC28DACC2C79A061.description: Grammar: Use relative pronouns and relative adverbs. (Introduce)

251AB3644E5E4E4F9A9097B4976B047A.description: Mechanics: Recognize and use conventional capitalization, quotation marks, and commas to indicate exact words and dialogue. (Continue)

8399C8AED7DC4CF98623E13EC16F8C1D.description: Grammar: Form and use comparative and superlative adjectives and adverbs. (Continue)

CCFA1CEC4E704E75B4CF32664F92E426.description: Grammar: Form and use prepositional phrases. (Continue)

4B69F78FE99146268FD07CBF6A09DFA8.description: Mechanics: Use hyphens to divide words at line breaks. (Master)

C14E65A2DFF04CEC8EAB2A4E45575C7E.description: Mechanics: Use commas with coordinating conjunctions to join independent clauses. (Master)

22EEDCDA6A2647E794BFB747B8287A5A.description: Grammar: Use collective and abstract nouns. (Master)

12E7F93C927D4B9C80133328A33AD330.description: Grammar: Use coordinating conjunctions to join words, phrases, or clauses. (Master)

8DE216C6EC66459DB315A6E8B2981F94.description: Grammar: Form and use the past tense of irregular verbs. (Master)

48CB7F53A4E542B280979502ECA74628.description: Grammar: Form and use irregular plural nouns. (Master)

1CF79478CF974E50BA2EFA106E558711.description: Mechanics: Use apostrophes to form contractions and singular possessive nouns. (Master)

1D5BB4CDFA4849FCBF7480903216A469.description: Grammar, Usage, & Mechanics Learn and apply conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics to aid the comprehension and analysis of texts and to communicate clearly and precisely in written and spoken language.

C9783BFB9698470D8A5427439DB658E9.description: Grammar Conventions Students observe, analyze, and use the structures and conventions of Standard English grammar, usage, and mechanics as they interpret and construct texts.

E90FFEB34A15474EB6561043BD42C9EE.description: Language (L) Students learn and apply the structures and conventions of standard English. Students observe and analyze how grammar works in reading and writing. Students build vocabularies and determine word meanings as they relate to reading and writing.

97BFA2D0D1F94275A5E8C050188A0F07.description: Build background knowledge by reciting all or part of significant poems and speeches as appropriate by grade level. (I/C)

56070C0DC23C4C289BCC03C5ED8A869B.description: Engage in dialogue with audiences by asking and answering questions. (I/C)

D8FCA440EB7449DB82CFEA55F07002B2.description: Vary tone, pace, and nonverbal gestures as appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

8315AA3FE2014E83B85EDAC1EB500D70.description: Integrate modes and genres most appropriate to purpose and audience. (I/C)

42A2FC862EDA43FA8A7C16B4270BC339.description: Communicate clearly to present ideas, information, and texts. (I/C)

EBE1692F336644AF9532F3D12E636764.description: Presentation Use presentation skills to tailor communication to target audiences for specific purposes.

004542804C924904BE072F7C57E6406A.description: Work with others to discuss topics, investigate questions, solve problems, and explore and create texts. (I/C)

16A4A21496B14110BCCDB150FC534B43.description: Contribute to discussions and shared projects by offering ideas, listening to the ideas of others, and providing feedback. (I/C)

A60FDABAAACB4B5D88AD1192D1C2738D.description: Collaborate with others to determine group norms, establish goals and procedures, and facilitate productivity when working on shared projects. (I/C)

54CB315C8D09418285543EAE55FC2E22.description: Arrive to group discussions and collaborative meetings prepared to be an active participant in the work. (I/C)

6F31029294F7429DAF74F219B5B25119.description: Collaboration Collaborate with others to accomplish shared goals and projects.

E240780030AA4C13BF3A3DBB8B57A104.description: Collaboration & Presentation Students build and share knowledge as they engage with others in a range of settings and for a variety of purposes.

9E8387F775714296B667AD81B2D9F1CF.description: Consume and produce multimodal texts, integrating a variety of genres, text features, and craft techniques to influence target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

551DF82752DC41A1851496C0781D9BC6.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact how ideas and information are structured and arranged in texts. (I/C)

247F81BF4885447C9D814CBC0FE84457.description: Apply knowledge of how mode and genre impact what kinds of ideas and information are included in texts. (I/C)

29EDF03A98D94E078FDCA17BE9025522.description: Explore and create texts in various modes and genres, developing and applying knowledge of how specific features impact meaning, tone, style, purpose, and audience. (I/C)

23A67797B01146EBBF1871144E94DC3D.description: Text Design Consider the impact of text design on audience and purpose when consuming and producing texts across modes and genres.

515EAF7E005F42C0A1B5D3E27B56B959.description: Organize texts by incorporating specific formats, structures, patterns, and features to influence the audience, facilitate accessibility, and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

AFE64017ABA943C5A51D2336E6C1BD77.description: Make decisions about sentence structure and syntax in order to accommodate and influence the audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

5B00F2B14C9C4C12B79F0301BFA77863.description: Craft words and phrases in order to influence the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions of the target audience and achieve a specific purpose. (I/C)

C16EA166766F4F7292390B211147B8F7.description: Integrate literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements to appeal to target audiences and achieve specific purposes. (I/C)

7852DFD5453E4E6399B3C99A769F5933.description: Writing like a Reader Construct texts with the audienceâ€™s experience in mind, basing decisions about craft techniques on context and purpose.

4049DDEF8BEE40E7A15FAC1BF9C98EE4.description: Describe, analyze, and evaluate the design and organization of the text, explaining how specific formats, structures, patterns, and features influence the audience, contribute to the textâ€™s accessibility, and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

D455D8BB257B4F1A9294EAC80D0995D5.description: Explain, analyze, and evaluate how the authorâ€™s use of sentence structure and syntax affects the target audience and supports the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

95913092AAA04633800B596BA276D501.description: Identify, apply, and analyze important, interesting, or effective uses of language, explaining or evaluating how specific word choices affect the target audience and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

FF9C1A39FB3349178F3858BB6AA2A25A.description: Identify, apply, and analyze the literary, expository, and opinion (grades K-5) or rhetorical (grades 6-12) elements in texts, explaining or evaluating how specific elements affect the target audience and support the textâ€™s purpose. (I/C)

16D27B664E5A41B398DDB438A064AC0B.description: Reading like a Writer Interpret texts through the authorâ€™s lens by identifying, analyzing, and evaluating craft techniques that are connected to the responses, thoughts, decisions, and questions triggered by the text.

F2B50B686631474380F8162A527E0DA5.description: Authorâ€™s Craft Students apply knowledge of authorâ€™s craft to enhance the interpretation and construction of texts.

0C75A0E1382D411D845A6C9F947CF8D0.description: Draw from knowledge of how authors consider context and audience to determine which information and ideas to highlight, which text design is most accessible, which word choices and language structures are most effective, and which craft techniques are most impactful. (I/C)

319C8F7947394DCEB6A5BC327AC0F0C5.description: Draw from knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish a clear point of view or unique perspective when interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

FBEAC8DE0F0047099B89F4DACF05BFB5.description: Develop and apply knowledge of author, audience, and context to discern and establish the purpose of texts being interpreted or constructed and to evaluate the extent to which those texts achieve those purposes. (I/C)

4035E465FD6043E39E4C7FC47B6A0F91.description: Author, Audience, & Purpose Interpret and construct texts by developing and applying knowledge of the strategies and techniques authors use to accommodate the target audience and achieve the textâ€™s purpose.

F3E360AEFB6341D6ADA5ADE4665B458C.description: Explore how context shapes the authorâ€™s decisions and the audienceâ€™s responses during the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

019AD2D8808641438ADA2CF0F207243A.description: Consider how context impacts the purposes of the author and the audience. (I/C)

021D789E63334D0C929CFB610B5184DF.description: Use prior knowledge, formal or informal research, and discussions with others to identify the key components of context that are most relevant. (I/C)

4C81706E48E347AFA13C8CDCDAAD4666.description: Context Develop and apply knowledge of key components of context such as background information, geographic location, cultural influences, time period, and contemporary events when interpreting and constructing texts.

9739476D6A6442B1A2FE6E9F726B84FA.description: Situating Texts Students develop and apply a multilayered understanding of context, author, audience, and purpose to ground and propel the interpretation and construction of texts.

C2DED534F0E5466C859A9EC288395318.description: Edit the text, ensuring it adheres to the conventions of written language. (C)

65725CC789B346B784DB648C21A04F0F.description: Make changes to the text based on self-evaluation or external feedback, revising the organization, ideas, information, word choices, and craft techniques in order to increase the textâ€™s effectiveness. (C)

EACA75E48D8B498A835CA257110CEED3.description: Evaluate the textâ€™s effectiveness based on self-review or feedback from others, determining whether the text matches the purpose and goals for writing. (C)

DC0E30A5F25A437EA5DA7FD2BED8F1B3.description: Construct an initial draft by integrating ideas and information; selecting words, phrases, and sentences; and incorporating craft techniques that will best achieve the purpose of the text and resonate with the target audience. (C)

117A59735352461ABAC87709F9CC2B61.description: Link ideas and information to the organization plan, highlighting ideas and information that are most relevant, useful, and impactful. (C)

41E9269C0BA14A6FA79399AB4969BDC6.description: Generate ideas for content by assessing prior knowledge, gathering information from texts, and engaging in discussions with others. (C)

45A68C3A636645558A76BC7D912A5CAA.description: Plan how to organize the text by selecting modes, genres, and structures that will achieve the purpose and meet the needs of the target audience. (C)

9EB8B2A0749648DE8BC35B095142EA79.description: Establish a purpose and goals for writing and identify a target audience. (C)

BE2882A63CAF4764A10F92F0C2039C27.description: Writing Processes Compose a range of texts for a variety of purposes and audiences, flexibly engaging in writing processes to plan, draft, evaluate, revise, and edit texts.

878F302D2902464DAF401A5E61E18BFF.description: Determine the meanings of unfamiliar words and concepts by applying knowledge of context and of academic vocabulary and word parts. (I)

14B8BBF4454E45BA84065E3932931DCB.description: Make, track, and support inferences about different levels of meaning within the text. (I)

5391C0A5923547ACBA8C9F950AE0BDA9.description: Make and track predictions about the events and information likely to come next. (I)

5CBE046A6E59439AAB8908FCC857CB13.description: Summarize and visualize sections of the text to maintain understanding. (I)

6C850DC8949943C5A59366B2E6E50811.description: Draw from, compare, build, and integrate prior knowledge with the material in the text, addressing inconsistencies or gaps and adding to knowledge repertoires as appropriate. (I)

992876658FFD44939F360BD6B8FEFE32.description: Scan and skim the text, making note of structures and sections that might be most useful. (I)

B1B5AF15C50645D38474FD55AA9098E6.description: Establish a purpose and set goals for reading, monitor comprehension, and adjust as needed. (I)

ABEA32A5AEB9451A8A86BCCCF42941F8.description: Comprehension Strategies Engage with a range of complex texts for a variety of tasks and purposes, accessing and using strategies for comprehension* before, during, and after reading as part of the meaning-making process.

5B2BC89570694F5EB9F93DFF4B7FE616.description: Consume and produce texts in order to solve problems or influence decisions. (I/C)

2F3E54BB11AA490D83BE676C83BEDDBF.description: Interpret and construct texts to aid the analysis and evaluation of texts and ideas. (I/C)

F6B03C2023314BE99A7CE181B89A8E1B.description: Explain and learn concepts and processes by interpreting and constructing texts. (I/C)

E5A6BC15BA20490690F7D719C9350389.description: Make use of texts to build knowledge, develop skills, make informed decisions, and share information and ideas. (I/C)

D10A66B518684363BF898DB98F896DF6.description: Share real or imagined experiences by interpreting and constructing texts that tell or include stories. (I/C)

0EB29BC9B8CF4A9D8DC9DB5E39766DA9.description: Engagement & Intention Engage in written or spoken dialogue as author and audience for a variety of tasks and purposes, making intentional connections within, between, and beyond texts.

EA1682B5EB8C478A84EE4A170614726A.description: Develop independence and autonomy as a reader and writer. (I/C)

3ABBB9906DBE4F598CDAE5A158B56385.description: Participate in a community of readers and writers by developing group norms, discussing texts, sharing individual writing, listening as others share their writing, and offering and responding to feedback. (I/C)

0D8B543B54CC431195C19B6209C3E05A.description: Build a repertoire of comprehension and composition skills, strategies, and techniques, drawing from them as needed to aid the interpretation and construction of texts. (I/C)

71FD541B5B054655B899388D2AA09246.description: Select, read, and write texts of personal interest and academic relevance to grade-level texts and topics. (I/C)

084A6767B48441E9A39A615DA80F63A2.description: Discuss or write about personal and academic reading and writing preferences, referring to specific techniques, topics, modes, and genres that resonate most. (I/C)

9A0D07A12DAC4C14864F03B32ECA40A1.description: Generate, understand, monitor, and discuss personal and academic reading and writing goals, revising as appropriate. (I/C)

B462BCB9052C403184985FE061ECCBE4.description: Reader & Writer Identity Build an identity as a reader and writer, developing a repertoire of resources and tools to continuously expand participation as an active consumer and producer of texts.

15D984754F764741820D0C45F2BAE3C2.description: Engagement & Intention for Comprehension & Composition Students develop personal and academic identities as readers and writers, approaching texts for a variety of tasks and purposes and engaging in reading and writing processes in order to deepen comprehension and strengthen composition.

ED0949F79E2C40CE96ACC05F895FEE4B.description: Practices (P) Students engage routinely in four literacy practices that ground, shape, and inform the expectations of the Foundations, Language, and Texts domains.

FE1C4E2719FF4118B27664C130EF75FF.description: Use appropriate spacing between cursive words in a sentence.

97AF8677AF744352B50DE46FC26A81C7.description: Practice forming cursive letters and connectors in words.

A09BC11793D8482B9618C8A46444DFA2.description: Write Cursive Use fine motor skills to form legible letters and words in cursive.

388E42B3F7CB43B5A305ABD7A40F686B.description: Motor Skills & Letter/Word Formation This progression ends in 2nd grade.

BB2BA92A45C84F8A892C713BFEB0BDCA.description: Handwriting Students develop handwriting skills in cursive.

E0884C4AD7394B6E93BFC7C68BD1F448.description: Self-correct while reading grade-level text (silently or aloud) to aid comprehension and fluency, rereading as necessary.

2371224949C04AB2964D9DF417896DD8.description: Read a wide range of grade-level texts aloud with appropriate prosody (phrasing, expression, juncture/pause, and intonation) to aid comprehension.

638A7588C79942F0AFF6CC8568F379C8.description: Read a variety of unfamiliar grade-level texts with increasing accuracy.

B01E68EEEC464EFAA778F9AB35DB456F.description: Increase sight word vocabulary by reading regularly and irregularly spelled words in isolation and context with accuracy and automaticity.

23D9ECD316C047E88B8174578207240C.description: Oral & Silent Reading Fluency Demonstrate oral and silent reading fluency to read grade-level texts for understanding, self-correcting as necessary to ensure accuracy and aid comprehension.

50647A55057B4928BE0C350B6792E871.description: Fluency Students read texts aloud or silently with speed, accuracy, and expression.

0E3A3BCF122B4051874237FA37EF4655.description: Decode and encode words with common prefixes and suffixes.

09ADB9F0394E494D888CC14500BD75BF.description: Decode and encode words with graphemes that represent multiple letter-sound correspondences.

F339666E033145DF96B66FF6C4537043.description: Phonics Students learn the relationships between the sounds of spoken language and the letters of written language as they decode and encode words in context and in isolation.
